alert.note: Alert for Skagit (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 8:48AM PST until December 07 at 1:34AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. Skykomish River Near Gold Bar affecting Snohomish County. Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Tolt River Above Carnation affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. .Heavy rain will continue in the Washington Cascades through this afternoon. Another 1 to 3 inches of rain is forecast before the rain rates ease. For the North West Region...including Saxon Bridge, North Cedarville, Ferndale, Burlington, Concrete, Mt. Vernon, Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. For the Central West Region...including Gold Bar, Monroe, Snohomish, Snohomish, Carnation, Snoqualmie Falls, Carnation, Issaquah, Landsburg, Renton, Auburn...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skagit River near Concrete. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 37.0 feet, the Skagit River will cause major flooding from Rockport downstream through Sedro Woolley. Deep and swift flood waters will inundate many roads...farms...and some business and residential areas especially Cape Horn...Hamilton...and Thunderbird. Cockreham Island...the Nookachamps area and the Sterling area will be inundated. Levees east of Sedro Woolley may be damaged. This level for this location on the Skagit corresponds to a Phase 1 flood in the Skagit County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 28.4 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM PST Tuesday was 28.4 feet. - Forecast...The river rose above flood stage this morning and is expected to rise to a crest of 38.0 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 500 PM PST.
